title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22 ยง 1020.3 - Duties and authority of attorney grievance committees
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22 ยง 1020.3 - Duties and authority of attorney grievance committees

State Regulations

Attorney grievance committees in the Fourth Judicial

Department shall: (a) consider and
investigate all matters involving allegations of professional misconduct by any
person or firm covered by section
1240.1
of this Title; (b) supervise staff attorneys in the
performance of their duties before the committee; (c) appoint sub-committees to assist in
investigations when necessary and appropriate; (d) authorize the chief attorney to commence
a proceeding in the Appellate Division when the public interest requires prompt
action or when such proceeding is otherwise permitted under law or the rules of
the court; and
(e) maintain and
provide to the Appellate Division statistical reports, in a form approved by
the court, summarizing the processing and disposition of all matters before the
committee. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22
ยง
1020.3

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
